org.dei.whynot

Class CheckWorkingMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dei.whynot.CheckWorkingMemory

  • public class CheckWorkingMemory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class CheckWorkingMemory is used to verify why a conclusion is false, searching for the causes that prevented a conclusion to be obtained.

    • Method Summary

      • conclusionFromRuleDoesNotExist

        protected boolean conclusionFromRuleDoesNotExist(java.lang.String ruleName,
                                                 java.lang.String functor,
                                                 java.lang.String DRLConclusion)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks if a conclusion from a rule does not exist in the working memory.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - the name of the rule
        functor - the functor of the conclusion
        DRLConclusion - the DRL conclusion string
        Returns:
        true if the conclusion does not exist, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is an error during the check

        Checks if a condition is false in the working memory.
        Parameters:
        drlCondition - the DRL condition string
        Returns:
        true if the condition is false, false otherwise
